page.title: 18BELLINGHAM,ELDERLY.
page.content: The old peoples'home at Bellingham is ten years old,there is only one person employed there and she has worked there since the home opened.There are fourteen flats,six double and eight single rooms. There are three stages in the old peoples' care, they first live in a bungalow ,then a home help visits,then a twenty four hour health care service is introduced.The home is owned and run by Tynedale District Council.The women have to be sixty and men have to be sixty five before they can be moved into a bungalow,but the council lower the age for disabled people.The Tynedale Council will not employ unmarried women as they have to work with men as well as women.
